Throws:

                    int token,

             throws DigiDocException

DigiDocException - for decryption errors

encryptStream

public void encryptStream(java.io.InputStream in,
                          java.io.OutputStream out,
                          int nCompressOption)
                   throws DigiDocException
Encrypts all input data coming from this stream, compresses it if necessary converts to base64 and writes as an XML encrypted document to output stream. Use this method to encrypt big amunts of data. Please note that you must first inittialize the recipients (e.g. EncryptedKey objects) but not the data. Data comes from the input stream, thus data status should be UNINITIALIZED when you call this method.

Parameters:
in - stream with data to encrypt
out - output stream for encrypted data
nCompressOption - compression option: allways, never. Best-effort is not supported here because we don't know it before we have encrypted eveything end then we don't want to redo this.
Throws:
DigiDocException - for encryption errors

toXML

public byte[] toXML()
             throws DigiDocException
Converts the EncryptedData to XML form

Returns:

Throws:
DigiDocException
